snippet: The punishment has raised the fear that new lines are being drawn between loyalty and treason.
abstract: Kuwait is increasingly wielding its right to revoke citizenship, penalty that has long been rare in country known as most politically open of Persian Gulf monarchies; effort is part of attempt to crack down on political dissent while world's attention is focused on militant extremists in Iraq and Syria.
lead_paragraph: The punishment has raised the fear that new lines are being drawn between loyalty and treason.

headline.main: Kuwait, Fighting Dissent From Within, Revokes Citizenship
headline.print_headline: Kuwait, Fighting Dissent From Within, Uses Citizenship as a Weapon
